title: Red Team Tradecraft
description: Comprehensive tutorials for EDR-aware testing and ATT&CK-mapped adversary emulation covering operational security, detection avoidance, and realistic threat actor behaviors.

steps.title: EDR Evasion Fundamentals
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Understand EDR detection surfaces and basic evasion techniques

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Identify EDR products (CrowdStrike, Defender ATP, Carbon Black)
2. Map detection capabilities (process injection, fileless malware, network beacons)
3. Implement basic evasion (obfuscation, living-off-the-land)

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- EDR agent processes and services
- Telemetry collection points
- Behavioral analysis triggers

steps.title: Living Off The Land (LotL)
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Use native system tools to avoid custom malware detection

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Enumerate built-in tools (PowerShell, WMI, BITS, COM objects)
2. Chain native commands for persistence and lateral movement
3. Avoid dropping files when possible

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Suspicious command-line arguments
- Unusual process parent-child relationships
- Native tool abuse patterns

steps.title: Fileless Malware Techniques
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Execute code without touching disk to evade file-based detection

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Use PowerShell reflection and memory-only execution
2. Implement process injection (APC, thread hijacking)
3. Leverage script engines (JScript, VBScript) for execution

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Memory-resident code artifacts
- Reflective loading indicators
- Script engine abuse

steps.title: Command & Control (C2) Obfuscation
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Hide C2 communications from network detection

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Implement domain fronting and CDN abuse
2. Use DNS tunneling and protocol smuggling
3. Apply traffic encryption and shaping

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Unusual outbound connections
- Encrypted traffic patterns
- DNS query anomalies

steps.title: Credential Access Without Detection
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Harvest credentials while avoiding authentication monitoring

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Use LSASS dumping with evasion techniques
2. Implement pass-the-hash/token theft
3. Leverage Kerberoasting and ASREPRoasting

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Memory access patterns
- Authentication anomalies
- Ticket manipulation indicators

steps.title: Lateral Movement Tradecraft
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Move through networks using EDR-aware techniques

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Use WMI and PowerShell remoting
2. Implement DCOM/RPC abuse
3. Leverage RDP and VNC with session hijacking

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Remote execution artifacts
- Network session anomalies
- Administrative tool abuse

steps.title: Persistence Mechanisms
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Maintain access using hard-to-detect persistence methods

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Implement scheduled task abuse
2. Use registry autoruns with camouflage
3. Create service backdoors with legitimate names

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Startup modification indicators
- Service creation events
- Registry key changes

steps.title: Data Exfiltration Techniques
steps.content:

3. Leverage cloud storage abuse

steps.title: Anti-Forensic Measures
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Cover tracks and avoid forensic detection

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Implement log manipulation and clearing
2. Use timestomping and artifact removal
3. Deploy anti-forensic tools

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:

- File timestamp changes
- Evidence destruction indicators

steps.title: ATT&CK Framework Mapping
steps.content:
OBJECTIVE: Structure operations using MITRE ATT&CK for comprehensive coverage

STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS:
1. Map tactics (Recon, Initial Access, Execution, etc.)
2. Select techniques based on target environment
3. Chain techniques for realistic emulation

WHAT TO LOOK FOR:
- Technique implementation artifacts
- Tactic progression indicators
- Emulation scenario coverage
